result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald E. Splittgerber Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond in the amount of $250.00 be applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The Court defers to agent the issue of no contact with N.S.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald E. Splittgerber Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

16CM-23 and 16CM-158 - Both Cases Called. Defendant Ronald E. Splittgerber in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions Def as to status of counsel.  Def requests to speak with the State on resolution w/o counsel.  Off Rcord for Defendant to speak with the State.  Back of Record @ 2:08 PM:  Global resolution recited by ADA.  Defendant confirms resolution reached.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. ADA confirms that any claim for Rest is withdrawn as to 16CM-23 based on performance.  16CM-158 Plea: GP   Court accepts plea and enters JOC.   Statement by Def:  Yes - requests no contact provisions be dropped.  The Court:  Will follow recommendation - S/W as to both cases - 1 yr. probation with concurrent terms.  Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru as recommended;  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Court defers to agent the issue of no contact with N.S.; Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP - Bond to be applied of $250 to be applied. DNA Sample ordered, unless previously provided and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  3 days TS credit.  Appeal Rights Given.
by USPS - No Mail Receptacle - Unable to Forward
Status conference on May 10, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant appears via video from the WC Jail.

Case called @ 1:04 p.m. Defendant Ronald E. Splittgerber in court, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant wishes to have counsel - will attempt to privately retain counsel. ADA Anderson requesting $250 Cash Bond. Statement by DE regarding bond. Court orders $250 Cash Bond.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
